description: AI Models, Local LLMs, and Language Model Tools

skill-marketplace.name: skill-marketplace
skill-marketplace.description: Agent Skills marketplace for Claude Code and other AI coding tools

toolszera.name: toolszera
toolszera.description: ToolsZera is an ai tools app.

quilltap.name: quilltap
quilltap.description: AI Chat with characters, memories, projects, tool use, and more

aimmy.name: aimmy
aimmy.description: Aimmy is a free, AI-based aim aligner developed by BabyHamsta and Nori to enhance gaming accessibility. Unlike similar tools, it utilizes DirectML, ONNX, and YOLOV8 technologies, and is written in C#, ensuring efficient performance even on AMD GPUs

siteguru.name: siteguru
siteguru.description: Personal unified command center — email, music, social, dev tools, and AI agent sidekick in one dashboard. Built with Next.js, Railway, Vercel.

menonlab-blog.name: menonlab-blog
menonlab-blog.description: Tech insights on AI, ML, and open-source tools

cursor-workspace.name: cursor-workspace
cursor-workspace.description: Reusable Cursor rules and agent skills for consistent, AI-assisted coding and domain guidance across projects.

conductor.name: conductor
conductor.description: AI integration hub — 25 plugins, 146 tools. Connect Claude, GPT-4o, Gemini & Ollama to Gmail, Spotify, GitHub Actions, Vercel, n8n, Notion and more. One installer. MCP + Telegram.

cockpit-tools.name: cockpit-tools
cockpit-tools.description: 通用 AI IDE 账号管理工具：支持 Antigravity / Codex / GitHub Copilot / Windsurf / Kiro，多账号切换、配额监控、自动唤醒与多开实例管理。 Universal AI IDE account manager for Antigravity / Codex / GitHub Copilot / Windsurf / Kiro, with multi-account switching, quota monitoring, wake-up automation, and multi-instance management.

ai-training.name: ai-training
ai-training.description: Tools for training certain AI models

trends.description: Strong focus on AI-powered development tools, particularly around Cursor rules (cursor-workspace), IDE account management (cockpit-tools, 776 stars), and agent skills (skill-marketplace). Developer experience is the dominant use case.
4 of 10 projects use TypeScript (40%), with Next.js/Vercel being the dominant stack for AI application frontends. Rust used for performance-critical tooling (cockpit-tools).
Multiple projects attempting to unify disparate AI tools into single dashboards (siteguru, conductor, cockpit-tools) — consolidation trend in fragmented AI tooling landscape.
Emerging pattern of packaging AI behaviors as reusable 'skills' or 'rules' (skill-marketplace, cursor-workspace) — shift from one-off prompts to structured, reusable agent capabilities.

recommendations.text: Track cockpit-tools evolution: High-star count (776) and active Rust development suggests this fills a real pain point in AI IDE management. Monitor for feature expansion.
recommendations.rationale: Best-performing project indicates genuine developer need

recommendations.text: Consolidation opportunity: Multiple projects building unified dashboards — expect mergers or dominant platform to emerge within 6 months.
Watch TypeScript dominance: 40% usage suggests strong momentum. Evaluate Rust adoption for performance-critical AI tools.
